content: chess pawn pattern pattern for a crochet pawn mine measures around 3 inches 7 5 cm in height and is around 2 inches 5 5 cm wide i used a 3mm hook and size 3 light yarn materials needed -yarn in black white or gray -thinner yarn black or white for the smile -safety eyes or replacement i used 8mm ones -stuffing -crochet hook which matches the number on the yarn or is a little bit smaller the pattern is worked in spirals do not join at the end of each round american stitch terms stitches / abbreviations used magic_ring = magic_ring increase = increase inv decrease = invisible decrease single_crochet = single_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch main body 1 6 single_crochet in magic_ring 6 2 increase x 6 12 3 single_crochet increase x 6 18 4 2 single_crochet increase x 6 24 5 3 single_crochet increase x 6 30 6 7 8 9 30 single_crochet 30 10 3 single_crochet inv decrease x 6 24 11 2 single_crochet inv decrease x 6 18 insert the safety eyes i placed them between the 7th and 8th row and sew on the smile 12 single_crochet inv decrease x 6 12 stuff the head 13 12 single_crochet 12 14a in front loops only 12 single_crochet 12 15a single_crochet increase x 6 18 16a 2 single_crochet increase x 6 24 slip_stitch and fasten_off attach the yarn at one of the back loops and chain one 14b in back loops only 12 single_crochet 12 15b 16b 17 18 19 12 single_crochet 12 stuff the neck of the pawn 20 single_crochet increase x 6 18 21 2 single_crochet increase x 6 24 22 3 single_crochet increase x 6 30 23 4 single_crochet increase x 6 36 24 25 36 single_crochet 36 single_crochet and fasten_off bottom 1 6 single_crochet in magic_ring 2 increase x 6 12 3 single_crochet increase x 6 18 4 2 single_crochet increase x 6 24 5 3 single_crochet increase x 6 30 6 4 single_crochet increase x 6 36 slip_stitch fasten_off and leave a long tail to sew sew the bottom part on the body i used the mattress stitch and add more stuffing if necessary happy crocheting thanks
